1:
"Come, let us return to Yahweh.
\q For he has torn us to pieces, but he will heal us;
\q he has injured us, but he will bandage our wounds.
\q
2:
After two days he will revive us;
\q he will raise us up on the third day,
\q and we will live before him.
\q
4:
Ephraim, what will I do with you?
\q Judah, what will I do with you?
\q Your faithfulness is like a morning cloud,
\q like the dew that goes away early.
\q
5:
So I have cut them to pieces by the prophets,
\q I have killed them with the words of my mouth.
\q Your decrees are like the light that shines out.
6:
For I desire faithfulness and not sacrifice,
\q and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
\q
7:
Like Adam they have broken the covenant;
\q they were unfaithful to me.
8:
Gilead is a city of evildoers
\q with footprints of blood.
\q
11:
For you also, Judah, a harvest has been appointed,
\q when I will restore the fortunes of my people.
